title: >>> CHRISTMAS Chaos
body_text:
DODGEBALL DAY 1
... Valerie Winston defeats Lauren Winston, 3 to 1.
DODGEBALL 54
... Valerie Winston defeats Lauren Winston, 7 to 2.
The Winston Cup 3
When you think of classic matches, look no further than the massacre of SIXTY IX. For over a year, Lauren Winston was on a mission to finally defeat her older sister Valerie, avenging her losses of dodgeball's past. But the odds were stacked against her right from the start, or so it looked like.
Valerie had somehow managed to align with Kevin Fitzpatrick, Kurt Gassner, Tom Adams, Kevin Megill, Ryan Letsche, John Tronolone among others. And though they jokingly [and arrogantly] paraded in victory before the match's official beginning, it wasn't hard to notice the expressions on their enemies' faces either.
But Lauren had her share of stars too, like new blood Sascha Basista and Michael Butler, her own brother Jack Mess, Chris Adams, Kevin Adams, Mike "Sputz" and so many more that would have earned her her first win over her sister.
What would happen when the sisters Winston clashed in the first ever three-peat match in dodgeball history?
Perhaps the biggest difference between the teams was good ole' teamwork itself. Lauren put together a squad that ran like a well-oiled machine while Valerie's, though extremely talented, had few synergistic plays. Team Lauren had little problem reentering players from prison, even if it came down the wire. Team Valerie struggled to help their imprisoned teammates, especially when a single participant remained.
Several times during the event, Max O'Rielly (Team Lauren) was actually sitting in prison, would somehow catch an ally's ball, allowing him to rejoin his team. The lack of defensive strategy like this cursed Valerie at SIXTY IX and in turn, lead Lauren to the victory she never had.
Lauren Winston finally defeated her older sister Valerie, 5 to 2. Big ups to both participnats for making the 69th event one to remember.
Chaos at its Best: The Records of DODGEBALL SIXTY IX
- Attendance: 24
- Biggest Return: Jack Mess (Last appearance at DODGEBALL XXX-SEVEN)
- New Players: (2) Terra Bergquist and Michael Butler
- DODGEBALL SIXTY IX was the first Christmas Edition of Dodgeball.
-
Valerie Winston vs. Lauren Winston
was the first captains battle to take place at three different events. It was the first however to include Prison Ball.
- Like last week, the tennis lights, for whatever reason, went off at 8pm.
- Though the event ended about 10:30pm, only 7 games were played in all; a rather low number.
- The Butler family added another star to the mix with the agile Michael. For those unaware, Michael is the younger brother of powerhouse Jim Butler.
- In late news from last week's DODGEBALL 68, Lauren Stopa
did not
suffer a broken finger following the brutal blow she took to her right hand. Much credit to Lauren as she competed without fear at SIXTY IX.
Welcome to DODGEBALL 70
It doesn't get any bigger or more an exciting than this. The finals days leading up to the Season 7 finale have arrived. It has been one long, winding road through the past 9 events and at DODGEBALL 70, all will be rewarded with the soon-to-be classic encounter.
An invasion, a battle royal, Kerrin Marchese's last horrah, the return of Prison Ball, and perhaps most importantly light failure have truly made the 7th Season as unforgettable as possible. The culmination of it all comes this Saturday night,
December 30
, live only at Wall High School. Those interested in setting up can come at 6pm, the official start time of this upcoming ten event. Stay tuned to
dodgeball.livejournal.com
for all the late breaking news concerning this milestone event.
And for those that have not read the headline, "Ladies and Gentlemen" by Saliva is your DODGEBALL 70 theme song!
body_html:
DODGEBALL DAY 1 ... Valerie Winston defeats Lauren Winston, 3 to 1.
DODGEBALL 54 ... Valerie Winston defeats Lauren Winston, 7 to 2.

The Winston Cup 3
When you think of classic matches, look no further than the massacre of SIXTY IX. For over a year, Lauren Winston was on a mission to finally defeat her older sister Valerie, avenging her losses of dodgeball's past. But the odds were stacked against her right from the start, or so it looked like.

Valerie had somehow managed to align with Kevin Fitzpatrick, Kurt Gassner, Tom Adams, Kevin Megill, Ryan Letsche, John Tronolone among others. And though they jokingly [and arrogantly] paraded in victory before the match's official beginning, it wasn't hard to notice the expressions on their enemies' faces either.

But Lauren had her share of stars too, like new blood Sascha Basista and Michael Butler, her own brother Jack Mess, Chris Adams, Kevin Adams, Mike "Sputz" and so many more that would have earned her her first win over her sister.

What would happen when the sisters Winston clashed in the first ever three-peat match in dodgeball history?

Perhaps the biggest difference between the teams was good ole' teamwork itself. Lauren put together a squad that ran like a well-oiled machine while Valerie's, though extremely talented, had few synergistic plays. Team Lauren had little problem reentering players from prison, even if it came down the wire. Team Valerie struggled to help their imprisoned teammates, especially when a single participant remained.

Several times during the event, Max O'Rielly (Team Lauren) was actually sitting in prison, would somehow catch an ally's ball, allowing him to rejoin his team. The lack of defensive strategy like this cursed Valerie at SIXTY IX and in turn, lead Lauren to the victory she never had.

Lauren Winston finally defeated her older sister Valerie, 5 to 2. Big ups to both participnats for making the 69th event one to remember.

Chaos at its Best: The Records of DODGEBALL SIXTY IX
- Attendance: 24
- Biggest Return: Jack Mess (Last appearance at DODGEBALL XXX-SEVEN)
- New Players: (2) Terra Bergquist and Michael Butler

- DODGEBALL SIXTY IX was the first Christmas Edition of Dodgeball.
- Valerie Winston vs. Lauren Winston was the first captains battle to take place at three different events. It was the first however to include Prison Ball.
- Like last week, the tennis lights, for whatever reason, went off at 8pm.
- Though the event ended about 10:30pm, only 7 games were played in all; a rather low number.
- The Butler family added another star to the mix with the agile Michael. For those unaware, Michael is the younger brother of powerhouse Jim Butler.
- In late news from last week's DODGEBALL 68, Lauren Stopa did not suffer a broken finger following the brutal blow she took to her right hand. Much credit to Lauren as she competed without fear at SIXTY IX.

Welcome to DODGEBALL 70

It doesn't get any bigger or more an exciting than this. The finals days leading up to the Season 7 finale have arrived. It has been one long, winding road through the past 9 events and at DODGEBALL 70, all will be rewarded with the soon-to-be classic encounter.

An invasion, a battle royal, Kerrin Marchese's last horrah, the return of Prison Ball, and perhaps most importantly light failure have truly made the 7th Season as unforgettable as possible. The culmination of it all comes this Saturday night, December 30, live only at Wall High School. Those interested in setting up can come at 6pm, the official start time of this upcoming ten event. Stay tuned to dodgeball.livejournal.com for all the late breaking news concerning this milestone event.

And for those that have not read the headline, "Ladies and Gentlemen" by Saliva is your DODGEBALL 70 theme song!
